intro: Ferulago autumnalis, commonly known as autumn ferula, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features tall, branched stems with finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. Its yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family, and bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
